content.raw:
Sometimes it's a nice idea to spell out the commands, up to you ;) Something like:

~~~
mkdir ~/.gazebo/models/fisheye_camera
cd ~/.gazebo/models/fisheye_camera
~~~

~~~
gedit ~/.gazebo/models/fisheye_camera/model.config
~~~

~~~
gedit ~/.gazebo/models/fisheye_camera/model.sdf
~~~
content.html:
Sometimes it's a nice idea to spell out the commands, up to you ;) Something like:

mkdir ~/.gazebo/models/fisheye_camera
cd ~/.gazebo/models/fisheye_camera

gedit ~/.gazebo/models/fisheye_camera/model.config

gedit ~/.gazebo/models/fisheye_camera/model.sdf

~~~

content.raw:
The camera sways in a slow motion if you drop it in a weird way. Adding realistic inertia values helps:

~~~
      <inertial>
        <mass>0.1</mass>
        <inertia>
          <ixx>0.000166667</ixx>
          <iyy>0.000166667</iyy>
          <izz>0.000166667</izz>
        </inertia>
      </inertial>
~~~

For reference, I used [this](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_moments_of_inertia) to calculate it. I'll change this for the normal camera too.
content.html:
The camera sways in a slow motion if you drop it in a weird way. Adding realistic inertia values helps:

      <inertial>
        <mass>0.1</mass>
        <inertia>
          <ixx>0.000166667</ixx>
          <iyy>0.000166667</iyy>
          <izz>0.000166667</izz>
        </inertia>
      </inertial>

For reference, I used this to calculate it. I'll change this for the normal camera too.

content.raw: [gazebo_models pull request](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo_models/pull-requests/168/fix-inertia-for-cameras/diff)
content.html: gazebo_models pull request
